content: I wasn't quite sure on the call where we netted out on topic-per-project or what, but I'd like to announce a bit of a science experiment...
our main goal (at my company iqlusion) is to have a toy project to use to play with Libra's HotStuffBFT consensus algorithm outside of Libra itself
that said, the idea of a truly global sccache-style system seems to come up quite a bit, but the question is always "how can we trust it?"

I wasn't quite sure on the call where we netted out on topic-per-project or what, but I'd like to announce a bit of a science experiment...

I'd say topic per, well, topic -- not per team/wg or whatever. That'll be harder to track. :)
@Tony Arcieri Sorry if this is obvious, but is the goal of this project to produce deterministic builds from rustc? E.g. If I compiled a crate to WASM with synchronicity would it be reproducible?
indeed, or at least, that's the goal
